page.title: 09Public Houses
page.content: There are seven public houses in this area.Five of them are in Wootton village.These are the{Chequers}at Hall End,which has the date 1520 on the wall.It has been a public house since the 17th century.It is a timber-framed building now rough-cast rendered with an old clay tile roof.The{Fox and Duck in Bedford Road is an 18th century, old clay tiled roofed building.The {Black Horse}at Potters Cross is an 18th century building with an old clay tile roof.The{White Lion}and the {Cock}both date from early this century. The remaining two both in the east of the area each take their name from the dominant industry.They are the{ {Brickmakers Arms}on the A421 and the {Chimney Corner}on the A418.The tall brick chimney from which the latter got its name has since been demolished
